messages.message:
@ayesha.ali @prateek.tenkale I'm working on this ticket right (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-4645) now, which is referencing this Slack thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1754408130462429?thread_ts=1754049522.010579&cid=C05BJCNKZAM).

I'm trying to replicate the issue --  the thread says that `set-records` is being called with the wrong payload but when I edit GT classification, `set-records` isn't being called in the first place. I attached a video, am I missing something?
So gt sets use doc-based human review under the hood
`/extract` is the doc based human review endpoint
`/set-records` is for run based review which isn't applicable for gt sets
"set-records" in the description should really be referencing "extract"
Okay, ty for the explanation. Let me revisit this next week and I'll give y'all an update.
